answers.answer: This is a left Cranial Nerve 6 palsy, also called an Abducens nerve palsy.  The most common cause in elderly patients is damage to the nerve that controls the eye muscle that pulls the eye outward towards the ear.  Typically this happens in patients with a history of high blood pressure,  high cholesterol, diabetes, etc...anything that affects your blood vessels.  Your mom should be examined by either a neurologist or an Eye MD.  You should call her PCP to describe the situation and ask for a referral.  Note that this problem often gets better on its own and usually no specific treatment is offered in the early days after onset.

question: Hello,My Mother woke up a couple days ago with a dull ache behind her left eye. When I visited her this morning. I noticed that when she looks to her left, her left eye does not go all the way to the left. It kind of stops half way. Her right eye is fine. We just visited the optometrist who said the problem is caused by nerves and/or muscles at the back of the eye. She did a fill "optiscan" of the eyes and noticed no other issues. The optometrist said we should see our family doctor who could recommend us to an eye specialist. My mother continues to have a dull ache.What can cause this and what are possible solutions? Please let me know as I am worried.
title: Mom's Left Eye doesn't go all the way to the left
